messageBody:
Responding to Greider:

Greider wrote:
I am currently doing inserts for database test
data in a setup() method. This is getting rather
slow to run because it runs for each test (duh).

My answer:

You can easily achieve that your setup of the
database is run only once.
Consider the following code (It wont compile!)

public class MotherOfThisGroupOfDatabaseTests
extends TestCase
{

protected void setUp()
{
//Perform your initialisation here
}

public static Test suite()
{
TestSuite suite = new TestSuite();

suite.addTest(TestThisAspect.suite());
suite.addTest(TestThatAspect.suite());
//And so on!

return suite;
}
}

If some of your tests modify the database
so that they make fail other tests,
just create another group of tests

public class MotherOfThatGroupOfDatabaseTests
extends TestCase
{
}

Hope this helps!
